title: Arcangelo wins 155th Belmont Stakes
description: The 155th Belmont Stakes horse race was contested Saturday at Belmont Park in Elmont, New York.

title: North Carolina GOP censures Sen. Thom Tillis for straying from party on guns, immigration, LGBTQ+ rights
description: Republican Sen. Thom Tillis of North Carolina was censured by his state's annual GOP convention Saturday, with delegates accusing him of straying from conservatism on certain issues.

title: Stephen A. Smith says he wants Michael Irvin to join his ESPN show following suspension from NFL Network
description: Michael Irvin has been off the air since NFL Network removed him from its Super Bowl coverage, but if it were up to Stephen A. Smith, Irvin would return.

title: Conor McGregor sent Miami Heat mascot to hospital with punch: report
description: Conor McGregor was part of in-game entertainment during Game 4 of the NBA Finals in Miami Friday, but the situation turned serious for Burnie, the team's mascot.

title: Arizona plane crash in Superstition Mountains kills 2 people: NTSB
description: A single-engine Socata TB 30 Epsilon crashed in Arizona's Superstition Mountains near Apache Junction, authorities say. The NTSB reported that the two people on board died.

title: Oklahoma Gov. Stitt endorses DeSantis in 2024 Republican race, praises ‘dogged conviction’ in COVID-era
description: Oklahoma Gov. Kevin Stitt on Saturday announced his endorsement of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, marking a key conservative endorsement for the 2024 presidential hopeful.

title: Raptors to hire Grizzlies assistant Darko Rajakovic for head coach opening: report
description: The Toronto Raptors have reportedly tabbed Memphis Grizzlies assistant coach Darko Rajakovic to be the next head coach of the organization.

title: Pink-obsessed mom turns cottage into pastel-colored 'dream home'
description: A mom in the U.K., an Instagram influencer, has created a pastel-drenched "paradise" home. Sophia Ferrari-Wills, 35, began transforming a 1960s cottage in 2019 into her "dream home."

title: WNBA says Brittney Griner subject of 'inappropriate' incident involving social media 'provocateur'
description: The WNBA says Brittney Griner was the subject of an "inappropriate and unfortunate" incident at the Dallas airport, and a social media star tweeted his interaction with her.

title: RFK Jr.’s lawsuit spotlights alleged media collusion to censor 'misinformation'
description: Robert F. Kennedy, Jr.'s group, the Children's Health Defense, claims news organizations violated antitrust laws by collaborating to combat so-called "misinformation" online

title: Trump rails against Biden, 'deep state' at first speech after classified docs indictment: 'Political hit job'
description: Former President Donald Trump on Saturday blasted a "political hit job" in the form of a federal indictment accusing him of mishandling of classified documents.

title: Newly amended California bill could punish parents refusing to ‘affirm’ child’s gender identity
description: Newly amended California state bill AB 957 would require parents to recognize their kids' gender identities as part of their health and well being.

title: Los Angeles City Council advances motion to become nation's newest ‘sanctuary city’
description: Los Angeles moved closer to officially becoming a "sanctuary city" Friday after a unanimous City Council vote advancing a motion regarding immigrants there.

title: Conor McGregor gets booed during halftime of NBA Finals in Miami, knocks out Heat mascot
description: UFC legend Conor McGregor was courtside at the Miami Heat game on Friday, but when he spoke to the crowd, he did not get a warm reception.

title: Dave Portnoy accepts Kyrie Irving's challenge to pickup game after trading Twitter barbs: 'F--- it'
description: Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy and eight-time NBA All-Star Kyrie Irving have been trading Twitter barbs all week. Now, they may settle it on the court.

title: Biden speaks at White House Pride event: 'Bravest and most inspiring people I've ever known'
description: Biden's Pride Month 2023 celebration acclaimed the LGBT community as “the bravest and most inspiring people" and an "example" for the world to follow.

title: Jennifer Aniston, 54, fires back at people who compliment her age: ‘I can’t stand it’
description: 54-year-old actress Jennifer Aniston argued that a certain phrase is a backhanded compliment and that it drives her "bananas." Aniston reflected on her youth.

title: Native American tribe plans protests, considers suing Biden admin over oil-leasing crackdown
description: EXCLUSIVE: The Navajo Nation's president is warning that his tribe could soon take legal action against the Biden administration for its recent oil-drilling crackdown.

title: Asian American student speaks out on affirmative action: 'Deck is stacked against kids that look like me'
description: High school student Alex Shieh speaks out on raced-based college admission policies and what he sees as discrimination against Asian American applicants.

title: SPLC director who placed parents’ rights group on ‘hate map’ met with Biden counterterror official: report
description: According to White House visitor logs, the SPLC director who categorized parents' rights groups at extremist orgs met with Biden counterterrorism officials.

title: Iga Swiatek beats Karolina Muchova for third French Open title
description: Iga Swiatek defeated unseeded Karolina Muchova in the French Open final for her third championship at Roland Garros. Swiatek won 6-2, 5-7, 6-4.

title: Trump to make first public speech since federal indictment over classified docs
description: Former President Donald Trump on Saturday will speak to state Republican conventions in Georgia and North Carolina a day after he was indicted over document handling.

title: Dolphins’ Tyreek Hill eyes 2,000-yard receiving mark: ‘I want to break the record’
description: Miami Dolphins wide receiver Tyreek Hill told reporters Thursday he thinks he can break the 2,000-yard receiving mark this season after a spectacular first year in Miami.

title: Why you need to remove these malicious extensions now
description: You can remove malicious extensions from your Google Chrome software due its ability to create viruses that will eventually risk your computer being a target.

title: How to add your favorite websites to your device's home screen
description: Instead of scrolling through your Safari or Google browser on your smartphone, you can create a shortcut to have access to your favorite website immediately.

title: 'Crashed Las Vegas UFO' witness 'terrified' by 8-foot creatures in his backyard: '100% not human'
description: A witness to the possible crashed UFO in Las Vegas said he saw a "tall, skinny alien creature with greenish color" that was about eight to 10 feet tall.

title: Trans man goes viral after getting emotional about the ‘loneliness’ of life after gender transition
description: A trans man recently went viral for a video about the loneliness of life after the gender transition process suggesting it is easier to have friends as a woman.

title: RFK Jr. says it's 'hypocritical' to blame Canada for wildfires, 'foolish' to attribute problem to single cause
description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said it's "hypocritical" to blame Canada for the wildfire smoke coating parts of the East Coast and prompting air-quality concerns.

title: Biden admin confirms China spy base efforts in Cuba, calls it 'ongoing issue'
description: A Biden administration official on Saturday confirmed that China is working on increasing its spying efforts, including bases, in Cuba -- and it preceded the administration.

title: Former California deputy shocked at acquittal of attacker who shot at her: 'It just blows my mind'
description: Former San Bernardino County Sheriff's deputy Meagan McCarthy detailed the 'heartbreaking' attack and her reaction to her attacker being acquitted.

title: San Francisco shooting in Mission District leaves 9 injured: 'Targeted and isolated'
description: Nine people were injured in a shooting in San Francisco's Mission District on Friday night, authorities said.

title: Florida’s ‘Dr. Deep Sea’ resurfaces after 100 days living underwater, shattering previous record
description: A Florida professor, who spent 100 days living 30 feet underwater, resurfaced Friday breaking the record for the longest time living underwater without depressurization.

title: On this day in history, June 10, 1752, Benjamin Franklin famously flies kite during thunderstorm
description: Benjamin Franklin flew a kite in a storm and advanced humanity's understanding of electricity on this day in history, June 10, 1752. Franklin was also a U.S. statesman and founding father.
